body_html:
I solved this issue by changing the way I generate the import library pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib. Now the dll of my custom operators depend on _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.pyd instead of pywrap_tensorflow_internal.dll.

I still let the issue opened as the import library pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib should be included in the pip package as in TF 1.8.
body_text:
I solved this issue by changing the way I generate the import library pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib. Now the dll of my custom operators depend on _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.pyd instead of pywrap_tensorflow_internal.dll.
I still let the issue opened as the import library pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib should be included in the pip package as in TF 1.8.
body:
I solved this issue by changing the way I generate the import library pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib. Now the dll of my custom operators depend on _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.pyd instead of pywrap_tensorflow_internal.dll.

I still let the issue opened as the import library pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib should be included in the pip package as in TF 1.8.
